document.description: A new study found that Oldham County has the healthiest residents in the state. ... Dick Clark worked hard for his fortune, estimated in hundreds of millions; Rule change ...
document.body:

Top Oldham County News
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham County teacher wins presidential award and $10,000
An Oldham County eighth-grade math teacher has won a presidential award and $10,000 from the National Science Foundation.
Jul 10, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Rotary club to hold bourbon, wine tasting
The South Oldham Rotary Club will offer tastings of more than 30 bourbons and wines at its inaugural tasting event.
Jul 10, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Grandparents remembered
The history center collects artifacts and oral histories to identify the special places and events that make our community unique. The following recollection comes from the history center's family files and was contributed by Dorothy Oldson Brun.
Jul 10, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham County Fair Board president Buddy Head dies
Willie S. 'Buddy' Head, who was chosen to be grand marshal of Oldham County Day on July 21, died Saturday. He was 74.
Jul 9, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Summer programs offer students year-round learning
With barely enough time to make a dent in the couch this summer, some Oldham County students have quickly returned to school for a mental or physical workout.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham schools will use reserves to give employees raises
Oldham County Schools officials have dipped into reserves so that their employees can receive a raise beyond what is required by the state.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Goshen wildlife center denied permit to rehabilitate animals on site
The Second Chances Wildlife Center lost its request for a permit to rehabilitate animals on its property, but that doesn't mean it's shutting down.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
School board says goodbye to retiring superintendent
After starting out as a language arts teacher with Oldham County Schools, Paul Upchurch ascended the ranks to become superintendent.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham schools save $2 million on bonds
Oldham County Schools officials have saved roughly $2million by getting better interest rates on two bonds.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham History | New Castle made impression on Confederate general
The history center collects artifacts and oral histories to identify the special places and events that make our community unique. This article is about Confederate Gen. Edmond Kirby-Smith, who commanded the Trans-Mississippi Department of the Confederacy.
Jun 30, 2012
PETS /
Adopt a Pal | Sleepy
Meet Sleepy. She's a special dog. Severely underweight and filthy, she was found at a shelter. We pulled her and, due to her very sweet nature, put her into Camp Canine. Turns out she is older than we thought and really just needs a quiet, loving home.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Highlands/Crescent Hill
Blood Drives
Upper Highland Swim Club, 2411 Parkdale Ave., 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Wednesday. Kroger, 4501 Outer Loop, 3 to 7 p.m. Thursday. University of Louisville Medical School, 550 S. Preston St., 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Thursday.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Officials at 'The Quarry' in Oldham put a lid on alcohol
Playful, brightly colored, hand-painted signs greet visitors at Falling Rock Park, an Oldham swimming hole that's also known as 'the quarry' and that has become a favorite among Louisville-area young adults.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Northeast
Prospect set to fire up full July Fourth 'Boomsday' after last year's cuts
After having to cut the Independence Day fireworks in Prospect last year because of budgetary constraints, the patriotic display is back on this year.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
July Fourth festivities set for Oldham's Wendell Moore Park
Oldham Countians can celebrate Independence Day with music, games, a magic show and fireworks at Wendell Moore Park. The entertainment starts at 6 p.m. July 4, with the fireworks kicking off over the lake at 10 p.m.
Jul 3, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham County PVA violates ethics code, commission finds
The state Executive Branch Ethics Commission on Monday found Oldham County Property Valuation Administrator Ron Winters violated state government's ethics code when he promoted his wife.
Jul 2, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Southwest
Southeast Christian plans new southwest regional campus
Southeast Christian Church plans to build a new southwestern Louisville campus on 10 acres adjacent to Christian Academy of Louisville's campus on St. Andrews Church Road.
Jul 3, 2012
NEWS / Local News
Man dies in Oldham County crash
A 32-year-old Smithfield man was killed Sunday evening in Oldham County when the pickup truck he was driving left the road and flipped over. Oldham County Police said Darren Ellis was pronounced dead at the scene by the Oldham County coroner.
Jul 2, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham County issues burn ban
The high heat and dryness have led Oldham County Judge-Executive David Voegele to issue a total burn ban for the county. The ban began at noon Thursday and prohibits outside burning until it is lifted.
Jun 28, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Baptist Hospital Northeast to manage Oldham EMS
On Sunday, Baptist Hospital Northeast will assume management of Oldham County Emergency Medical Services, a public ambulance service that has operated full time in the county for 20 years.
Jun 27, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Locust Grove Chess Club members hone their skills at summer camp
In the Locust Grove Elementary School library, students hunch over their desks. Their assignment is centuries old, and even the most knowledgeable masters are still students of the field.
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Letter to the Editor | Not all in favor of incorporating Brownsboro
In response to the article in The Courier-Journal Neighborhoods section of today's paper, June 20, there seems to be a totally one-sided discussion on the incorporation of Brownsboro of a huge area to be called the Village of Brownsboro.
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Experience Oldham | Shakespeare takes on new meaning behind bars
Should I begin with the strangeness of passing through a metal detector, forfeiting my driver's license for a wristband that says 'Luther Luckett Correctional Complex' on it and then being handed a theater playbill?
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Northeast
Cemetery plans funeral home on Ballardsville Road
Louisville Memorial Gardens East, a cemetery on Ballardsville Road in northeast Louisville and Oldham County, plans to add a funeral home. A zoning change the cemetery needed was approved last week by the Louisville Mtero Planning Commission.
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham History | Military policewoman enjoys time in Afghanistan
Major Bobbi Jo Mayes of the 238th Regiment of the Kentucky Army National Guard is a 20-year veteran and holds 29 decorations, awards and citations as a military policewoman.
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham Fiscal Court cancels July 3 meeting
Oldham County Fiscal Court canceled its July 3 meeting because of the Independence Day holiday.
Jun 26, 2012
PETS /
Adopt a Pal | Cami
Cami is a black and tan border collie mix. She weighs 30 pounds and is about a year old. Cami is a medium energy dog. She appears to still have a lot of puppy in her and loves to play. She is a very sweet and loving little girl.
Jun 26, 2012
NEIGHBORHOODS / Oldham County
Oldham County wreck kills two teens
Two La Grange teenagers were killed early Saturday after fleeing from Oldham County sheriff's deputies and crashing their vehicle into a parked car and light pole, authorities said. Michael Tanner Wheat, 15, was driving the vehicle and died at the accident scene. The passenger, 14-year-old Autumn Foree, died at University Hospital.
Jun 24, 2012
